data.title: Where was Better Call Saul filmed?
data.meta_description: Find out which locations were used to film the hit show, "Better Call Saul" and discover where in the US you can visit to see them for yourself!

About Better Call Saul

Better Call Saul is an American legal crime drama television series that serves as a prequel to the critically acclaimed show Breaking Bad. Created by Vince Gilligan and Peter Gould, Better Call Saul delves into the trials and tribulations of Jimmy McGill, a small-time attorney in Albuquerque, New Mexico.

The series takes place years before Jimmy's infamous encounter with Walter White and Jesse Pinkman, showcasing his transformation into the morally compromised lawyer known as Saul Goodman. As Jimmy navigates the complex world of law, he grapples with his own moral compass and faces numerous challenges that test his principles.

One fun and unique fact about Better Call Saul is that it features several beloved characters from Breaking Bad, such as Jimmy's brother Chuck McGill (played by Michael McKean), Mike Ehrmantraut (portrayed by Jonathan Banks), and the notorious drug lord Gustavo Fring (portrayed by Giancarlo Esposito). The show masterfully weaves these characters into its narrative, providing fans with a deeper understanding of their origins and motivations.

The performances in Better Call Saul have been widely praised, particularly Bob Odenkirk's portrayal of Jimmy McGill/Saul Goodman. Odenkirk brings a nuanced and captivating performance that showcases the character's complexities and inner struggles.

Better Call Saul has been highly praised by critics, who recognize it as a remarkable achievement in producing a prequel and spinoff that surpasses expectations. It is often regarded as an outstanding successor to Breaking Bad, with some critics even considering it superior to the original series. In September 2019, The Guardian ranked Better Call Saul at No. 48 on their list of the top 100 TV shows of the 21st century, describing it as a meticulously crafted character-driven story that has continually improved as its central tragedy unfolds.

With its compelling storytelling, fascinating characters, and morally ambiguous themes, Better Call Saul has captivated audiences and secured its place as one of the most compelling television dramas of recent years.

Better Call Saul Locations

Better Call Saul, the critically acclaimed TV series and prequel to the iconic Breaking Bad, was primarily filmed in the vibrant city of Albuquerque, New Mexico, most of which were shot at Albuquerque Studios. Renowned for its picturesque landscapes and unique charm, Albuquerque provided the perfect backdrop for the majority of the show's captivating scenes.

Throughout the production, a variety of locations were carefully selected to bring the storyline to life. Notable landmarks, such as the iconic Pan American Building, beautifully portrayed the offices of HHM, exuding an aura of professionalism and intrigue. The captivating Cottonwood Mall, with its sprawling halls and bustling shops, made its appearance, leaving fans in awe of the show's attention to detail.

Beyond the city limits, the surrounding areas of Albuquerque offer a plethora of diverse attractions and landmarks that make a visit to these Better Call Saul filming locations truly worthwhile. Explore the breathtaking Sandia Mountains, with their majestic peaks and panoramic views, providing a stunning backdrop for some of the show's most intense moments. Delve into the enchanting beauty of the Rio Grande, as it winds its way through the city, adding a touch of serenity to the action-packed storyline.

Immerse yourself in the vibrant culture of Albuquerque and experience the extraordinary ambiance of this city firsthand. Explore hidden gems, indulge in mouthwatering New Mexican cuisine, and discover the secrets of Better Call Saul's filming locations.

After the conclusion of Breaking Bad, Saul Goodman (Bob Odenkirk) assumes the identity of "Gene Takavic" and works as a manager at a Cinnabon establishment located in Omaha, Nebraska. In his leisure time, he finds solace in watching an old VHS tape featuring a TV advertisement from 2005, reminding him of his past life as the charismatic lawyer, Saul Goodman.

Cottonwood Mall in Albuquerque, New Mexico, is a popular shopping destination with over 135 specialty stores, including prominent retailers like Dillard's, JCPenney, and Hobby Lobby. It offers a convenient and enjoyable shopping experience, along with entertainment options like Regal Cinemas. The mall has gained recognition as a retail hub, drawing visitors from surrounding areas.

To reach 10000 Coors Bypass NW in Albuquerque, start by heading west on Interstate 40 (I-40) from downtown Albuquerque. Take Exit 155B for Coors Blvd NW and merge onto Coors Blvd NW. Continue on Coors Blvd NW for approximately 6 miles until you reach the intersection with Coors Bypass NW. Turn right onto Coors Bypass NW and continue for about 0.7 miles. 10000 Coors Bypass NW will be on your right.

Jimmy (Bob Odenkirk) pays a visit to his brother Chuck (Michael McKean), who lives in seclusion and claims to suffer from electromagnetic hypersensitivity. Chuck's house is devoid of functional lights and appliances, with him relying on a lantern and a manual typewriter for his work. Despite offers from HHM, Chuck adamantly rejects any buyout and urges Jimmy to abandon the use of the McGill name in his legal career.

San Cristobal Road SW is a lively and colorful street in Albuquerque that is full of character and charm. Not only is it lined with incredible adobe-style homes that are full of history and architectural interest, but the street is also home to a bustling and vibrant community of people. You will find all sorts of local shops, restaurants, and cafes that are the perfect place to grab a bite to eat or pick up some unique souvenirs to take back home with you. Whether you are walking down the street admiring the beautiful architecture or simply soaking up the energy and vitality of the community, San Cristobal Road SW is a must-see spot on your trip to Albuquerque.

To get to 1607 San Cristobal Rd SW in Albuquerque, start by heading east on Central Ave SW from Coors Blvd NW. Then, make a right turn onto Rio Grande Blvd SW and drive south until you reach San Isidro St SW. Turn left onto San Isidro St SW and continue until you reach San Cristobal Rd SW. Finally, turn right onto San Cristobal Rd SW and you will find 1607 San Cristobal Rd SW on your left-hand side.

The initial encounter between Mike (Jonathan Banks) and Jimmy McGill (Bob Odenkirk) takes place when Mike is employed as a parking lot attendant at the Albuquerque courthouse. Mike's demeanor towards Jimmy is rather detached, often denying him entry through the parking gate due to insufficient validation stickers on his parking ticket.

If you're looking to explore the vibrant and eclectic city of Albuquerque, there's no better place to start than Marquette Ave. This charming street is teeming with local businesses, restaurants, and shops that offer a true taste of New Mexico's culture and cuisine; from hole-in-the-wall taco stands to trendy coffee shops, there's something for everyone to enjoy here. Whether you're a longtime resident or a first-time visitor, a stroll down this bustling street is sure to reveal something new and exciting.

To get to 102 Marquette Ave NE in Albuquerque, you can follow these directions: Start by heading to Central Ave NE in Albuquerque. From Central Ave NE, turn onto Marquette Ave NE. Continue on Marquette Ave NE until you reach 102 Marquette Ave NE, which will be on your left-hand side.

Following the puzzling disappearance of the Kettlemans and Nacho (Michael Mando) being taken into custody as the prime suspect, Jimmy (Bob Odenkirk) and Kim (Rhea Seehorn) decide to pay a visit to the Kettleman Residence in search of any overlooked evidence. It is during this investigation that Jimmy comes to the realization that the Kettlemans have not been kidnapped, but rather are intentionally concealing themselves in close proximity to their own home.

Tejana Mesa in Albuquerque is a neighborhood that captures the essence of New Mexico; with its stunning natural beauty, breathtaking mountain views, and rich history, it offers a unique blend of old-world charm and modern amenities. Experience the best of both worlds in this close-knit community nestled in the foothills.

To get to this location, you should follow these directions:

Start by heading towards Interstate 25 (I-25) in Albuquerque and take Exit 232A for Montgomery Blvd heading east. Continue on Montgomery Blvd NE until you reach Eubank Blvd NE and make a left turn onto Eubank Blvd NE. Follow Eubank Blvd NE until you reach Spain Rd NE. Make a right turn onto Spain Rd NE and continue until you reach Tejana Mesa Pl NE, where you make a left turn. The destination, 1520 Tejana Mesa Pl NE, will be on your left side.

Jimmy (Bob Odenkirk) makes his entrance and exchanges greetings with Mrs. Nguyen (Eileen Fogarty) and her staff; he makes a beeline for the cucumber water dispenser, which is designated for customers only. In an unconventional move, he drinks directly from the tap, mimicking a dog. Without delay, he proceeds to his office and forcefully removes his name sign from the door.

160 Juan Tabo Blvd in Albuquerque is a captivating street that showcases the city's charm; it's a major roadway connecting north and south Albuquerque, loved by locals and tourists alike. With Southwestern-style architecture and breathtaking views of the Sandia Mountains, driving down this boulevard offers a beautiful scenic experience. Whether it's the abundance of shopping centers, restaurants, and local businesses or the vibrant energy of the community, there's something about Juan Tabo that draws people in.

To get to 160 Juan Tabo Blvd NE in Albuquerque, you can follow these directions: Start by heading to Juan Tabo Blvd NE in Albuquerque. Continue on Juan Tabo Blvd NE until you reach 160 Juan Tabo Blvd NE, which will be on your right-hand side.
